attributes.action: Award Ambulance & NHS staff a COVID-19 medalic recognition award for this crisis
attributes.additional_details: As a disabled veteran with a higher risk to COVID-19 I recently had to use the Ambulance service first hand with COVID-19 and despite limited protection they still assisted me regardless of the risk of me passing it to them. Again once in hospital while in the Blue, respiratory area of Rotherham A&E All the staff had limited & certainly not fully protected with the PPE they should yet still unwaveringly treat me despite the risk. I’m sure repeat at hospitals around the country.
attributes.background: Once this COVID-19 crisis is over, the UK Government should award our Ambulance Service & NHS staff with medalic recognition just as the military were award medalic recognition for other medical emergencies overseas in the past. The Government has rightly called this a War footing against COVID-19

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302613

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
